31.16: Make Your face shine upon Your servant; Save me in Your lovingkindness.

31.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. In You, O LORD, I have placed my trust and taken refuge; Let me never be ashamed; In Your righteousness rescue me.
31.9: Be gracious and compassionate to me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; My eye is clouded and weakened by grief, my soul and my body also.
31.24: Be strong and let your hearts take courage, All you who wait for and confidently expect the LORD.

31.15: My times are in Your hands; Rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from those who pursue and persecute me.
31.20: In the secret place of Your presence You hide them from the plots and conspiracies of man; You keep them secretly in a shelter (pavilion) from the strife of tongues.
31.23: O love the LORD, all you His godly ones! The LORD preserves the faithful [those with moral and spiritual integrity] And fully repays the [self-righteousness of the] arrogant.
31.6: I hate those who pay regard to vain (empty, worthless) idols; But I trust in the LORD [and rely on Him with unwavering confidence].
31.4: You will draw me out of the net that they have secretly laid for me, For You are my strength and my stronghold.
31.19: How great is Your goodness, Which You have stored up for those who [reverently] fear You, Which You have prepared for those who take refuge in You,  Before the sons of man!
31.13: For I have heard the slander and whispering of many, Terror is on every side; While they schemed together against me, They plotted to take away my life.

5.7: But as for me, I will enter Your house through the abundance of Your steadfast love and tender mercy; At Your holy temple I will bow [obediently] in reverence for You.

5.2: Heed the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God, For to You I pray.
5.1: To the Chief Musician; on wind instruments. A Psalm of David. Listen to my words, O LORD, Consider my groaning and sighing.
5.12: For You, O LORD, bless the righteous man [the one who is in right standing with You]; You surround him with favor as with a shield.
5.4: For You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness; No evil [person] dwells with You.
5.6: You destroy those who tell lies; The LORD detests and rejects the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
5.5: The boastful and the arrogant will not stand in Your sight; You hate all who do evil.
5.8: O LORD, lead me in Your righteousness because of my enemies; Make Your way straight (direct, right) before me.

53.3: Every one of them has turned aside and fallen away; Together they have become filthy and corrupt; There is no one who does good, no, not even one.

51.16: For You do not delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it; You are not pleased with burnt offering.
51.3: For I am conscious of my transgressions and I acknowledge them; My sin is always before me.
51.5: I was brought forth in [a state of] wickedness; In sin my mother conceived me [and from my beginning I, too, was sinful].
51.18: By Your favor do good to Zion; May You rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation And sustain me with a willing spirit.
51.10: Create in me a clean heart, O God, And renew a right and steadfast spirit within me.
51.2: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness and guilt And cleanse me from my sin.
51.8: Make me hear joy and gladness and be satisfied; Let the bones which You have broken rejoice.
51.17: My [only] sacrifice [acceptable] to God is a broken spirit; A broken and contrite heart [broken with sorrow for sin, thoroughly penitent], such, O God, You will not despise.
51.11: Do not cast me away from Your presence And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
51.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had sinned with Bathsheba. Have mercy on me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness; According to the greatness of Your compassion blot out my transgressions.
51.9: Hide Your face from my sins And blot out all my iniquities.
51.14: Rescue me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation; Then my tongue will sing joyfully of Your righteousness and Your justice.
51.7: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean; Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
51.15: O Lord, open my lips, That my mouth may declare Your praise.
51.6: Behold, You desire truth in the innermost being, And in the hidden part [of my heart] You will make me know wisdom.
51.4: Against You, You only, have I sinned And done that which is evil in Your sight, So that You are justified when You speak [Your sentence] And faultless in Your judgment.
51.19: Then will You delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, In burnt offering and whole burnt offering; Then young bulls will be offered on Your altar.
51.13: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, And sinners shall be converted and return to You.

144.3: LORD, what is man that You take notice of him? Or the son of man that You think of him?
144.5: Bow Your heavens, O LORD, and come down; Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.
144.12: Let our sons in their youth be like plants full grown, And our daughters like corner pillars fashioned for a palace;
144.10: Who gives salvation to kings, Who sets David His servant free from the evil sword.
144.2: My [steadfast] lovingkindness and my fortress, My high tower and my rescuer, My shield and He in whom I take refuge, Who subdues my people under me.
144.8: Whose mouths speak deceit [without restraint], And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.11: Set me free and rescue me from the hand of [hostile] foreigners, Whose mouth speaks deceit [without restraint], And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.1: A Psalm of David. Blessed be the LORD, my Rock and my great strength, Who trains my hands for war And my fingers for battle;
144.9: I will sing a new song to You, O God; Upon a harp of ten strings I will sing praises to You,
144.14: Let our cattle bear Without mishap and without loss, And let there be no outcry in our streets!
144.7: Stretch out Your hand from above; Set me free and rescue me from great waters, Out of the hands of [hostile] foreigners [who surround us]
144.15: How blessed and favored are the people in such circumstance; How blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored] are the people whose God is the LORD!
144.6: Flash lightning and scatter my enemies; Send out Your arrows and confuse and embarrass and frustrate them.
144.4: Man is like a mere breath; His days are like a shadow that passes away.
144.13: Let our barns be full, supplying every kind of produce, And our flocks bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields;

13.3: Consider and answer me, O LORD my God; Give light (life) to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death,
13.2: How long must I take counsel in my soul, Having sorrow in my heart day after day? How long will my enemy exalt himself and triumph over me?
13.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. How long, O LORD? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?
13.4: And my enemy will say, "I have overcome him," And my adversaries will rejoice when I am shaken.
13.6: I will sing to the LORD, Because He has dealt bountifully with me.
13.5: But I have trusted and relied on and been confident in Your lovingkindness and faithfulness; My heart shall rejoice and delight in Your salvation.

23.3: He refreshes and restores my soul (life); He leads me in the paths of righteousness for His name's sake.
23.2: He lets me lie down in green pastures; He leads me beside the still and quiet waters.
23.1: A Psalm of David. The LORD is my Shepherd [to feed, to guide and to shield me], I shall not want.
23.4: Even though I walk through the [sunless] valley of the shadow of death, I fear no evil, for You are with me; Your rod [to protect] and Your staff [to guide], they comfort and console me.
23.6: Surely goodness and mercy and unfailing love shall follow me all the days of my life, And I shall dwell forever [throughout all my days] in the house and in the presence of the LORD.
23.5: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You have anointed and refreshed my head with oil; My cup overflows.

72.16: There will be an abundance of grain in the soil on the top of the mountains; Its fruit will wave like [the cedars of] Lebanon, And those of the city will flourish like grass of the earth.
72.3: The mountains will bring peace and prosperity to the people, And the hills, in [the establishment of] righteousness.
72.5: Let them fear You [with awe-inspired reverence and worship You with obedience] while the sun endures, And as long as the moon [reflects light], throughout all generations.
72.18: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, Who alone does wonderful things.
72.12: For he will rescue the needy when he cries for help, The afflicted and abused also, and him who has no helper.
72.10: The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring offerings; The kings of Sheba and Seba will offer gifts.
72.2: May he judge Your people with righteousness, And Your afflicted with justice.
72.8: May he also rule from sea to sea And from the River [Euphrates] to the ends of the earth.
72.17: May his name endure forever; May his name continue as long as the sun; And let men bless themselves by him; Let all nations call him blessed.
72.11: Yes, all kings will bow down before him, All nations will serve him.
72.1: A Psalm of Solomon. Give the king [knowledge of] Your judgments, O God, And [the spirit of] Your righteousness to the king's son [to guide all his ways].
72.9: The nomads of the desert will bow before him, And his enemies will lick the dust.
72.14: He will redeem their life from oppression and fraud and violence, And their blood will be precious in His sight.
72.7: In his days may the righteous flourish, And peace abound until the moon is no more.
72.15: So may he live, and may the gold of Sheba be given to him; And let them pray for him continually; Let them bless and praise him all day long.
72.20: The prayers of David son of Jesse are ended.
72.6: May he come down like rain on the mown grass, Like showers that water the earth.
72.4: May he bring justice to the poor among the people, Save the children of the needy And crush the oppressor,
72.19: Blessed be His glorious name forever; And may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen and Amen.
72.13: He will have compassion on the poor and needy, And he will save the lives of the needy.

45.16: In place of your fathers will be your sons; You shall make princes in all the land.
45.3: Strap Your sword on Your thigh, O mighty One, In Your splendor and Your majesty!
45.5: Your arrows are sharp; The peoples (nations) fall under You; Your arrows pierce the hearts of the King's enemies.
45.12: The daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; The rich among the people will seek your favor.
45.10: Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear [to my instruction]: Forget your people and your father's house;
45.2: You are fairer than the sons of men; Graciousness is poured upon Your lips; Therefore God has blessed You forever.
45.8: All Your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes and cassia; From ivory palaces stringed instruments have made You glad.
45.17: I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations; Therefore the peoples will praise and give You thanks forever and ever.
45.11: Then the King will desire your beauty; Because He is your Lord, bow down and honor Him.
45.1: To the Chief Musician; set to the [tune of] "Lilies." A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A skillful song, or a didactic or reflective poem. A Song of Love. My heart overflows with a good theme; I address my psalm to the King. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.
45.9: Kings' daughters are among Your noble ladies; At Your right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir.
45.14: She will be brought to the King in embroidered garments; The virgins, her companions who follow her, Will be brought to You.
45.7: You have loved righteousness (virtue, morality, justice) and hated wickedness; Therefore God, your God, has anointed You Above Your companions with the oil of jubilation.
45.15: With gladness and rejoicing will they be led; They will enter into the King's palace.
45.6: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of Your kingdom.
45.4: And in Your majesty ride on triumphantly For the cause of truth and humility and righteousness; Let Your right hand guide You to awesome things.
45.13: Glorious is the King's daughter within [the palace]; Her robe is interwoven with gold.

14.7: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When the LORD restores His captive people, Then Jacob will rejoice, Israel will be glad.
14.3: They have all turned aside, together they have become corrupt; There is no one who does good, not even one.
14.2: The LORD has looked down from heaven upon the children of men To see if there are any who understand (act wisely), Who [truly] seek after God, [longing for His wisdom and guidance].
14.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. The [spiritually ignorant] fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, they have committed repulsive and unspeakable deeds; There is no one who does good.
14.4: Have all the workers of wickedness and injustice no knowledge, Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And do not call upon the LORD?
14.6: You [evildoers] shamefully plan against the poor, But the LORD is his safe refuge.
14.5: There they tremble with great fear, For God is with the [consistently] righteous generation.

103.16: For the wind passes over it and it is no more, And its place knows it no longer.
103.3: Who forgives all your sins, Who heals all your diseases;
103.5: Who satisfies your years with good things, So that your youth is renewed like the [soaring] eagle.
103.21: Bless the LORD, all you His hosts, You who serve Him and do His will.
103.18: To those who honor and keep His covenant, And remember to do His commandments [imprinting His word on their hearts].
103.12: As far as the east is from the west, So far has He removed our transgressions from us.
103.10: He has not dealt with us according to our sins [as we deserve], Nor rewarded us [with punishment] according to our wickedness.
103.2: Bless and affectionately praise the LORD, O my soul, And do not forget any of His benefits;
103.22: Bless the LORD, all you works of His, in all places of His dominion; Bless and affectionately praise the LORD, O my soul!
103.8: The LORD is merciful and gracious, Slow to anger and abounding in compassion and lovingkindness.
103.17: But the lovingkindness of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting on those who [reverently] fear Him, And His righteousness to children's children,
103.11: For as the heavens are high above the earth, So great is His lovingkindness toward those who fear and worship Him [with awe-filled respect and deepest reverence].
103.1: A Psalm of David. Bless and affectionately praise the LORD, O my soul, And all that is [deep] within me, bless His holy name.
103.9: He will not always strive with us, Nor will He keep His anger forever.
103.14: For He knows our [mortal] frame; He remembers that we are [merely] dust.
103.7: He made known His ways [of righteousness and justice] to Moses, His acts to the children of Israel.
103.15: As for man, his days are like grass; Like a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
103.20: Bless the LORD, you His angels, You mighty ones who do His commandments, Obeying the voice of His word!
103.6: The LORD executes righteousness And justice for all the oppressed.
103.4: Who redeems your life from the pit, Who crowns you [lavishly] with lovingkindness and tender mercy;
103.19: The LORD has established His throne in the heavens, And His sovereignty rules over all [the universe].
103.13: Just as a father loves his children, So the LORD loves those who fear and worship Him [with awe-filled respect and deepest reverence].

87.7: The singers as well as the players of flutes will say, "All my springs and sources of joy are in you [Jerusalem, city of God]."
87.3: Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God [Jerusalem]. Selah.
87.2: The LORD loves the gates of Zion More than all the dwellings of Jacob (Israel).
87.1: A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A Song. His foundation is on the holy mountain.
87.4: "I will mention Rahab (Egypt) and Babylon among those who know Me— Behold, Philistia and Tyre with Ethiopia (Cush)— 'This one was born there.'"
87.6: The LORD will count, when He registers the peoples, "This one was born there." Selah.
87.5: But of Zion it will be said, "This one and that one were born in her," And the Most High Himself will establish her.

49.16: Be not afraid when [an ungodly] man becomes rich, When the wealth and glory of his house are increased;
49.3: My mouth will speak wisdom, And the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
49.5: Why should I fear in the days of evil, When the wickedness of those who would betray me surrounds me [on every side],
49.18: Though while he lives he counts himself happy and prosperous— And though people praise you when you do well for yourself—
49.12: But man, with all his [self] honor and pomp, will not endure; He is like the beasts that perish.
49.10: For he sees that even wise men die; The fool and the stupid alike perish And leave their wealth to others.
49.2: Both low and high, Rich and poor together:
49.8: For the ransom of his soul is too costly, And he should cease trying forever—
49.17: For when he dies he will carry nothing away; His glory will not descend after him.
49.11: Their inward thought is that their houses will continue forever, And their dwelling places to all generations; They have named their lands after their own names [ignoring God].
49.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. Hear this, all peoples; Listen carefully, all inhabitants of the world,
49.9: So that he should live on eternally, That he should never see the pit (grave) and undergo decay.
49.14: Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead); Death will be their shepherd; And the upright shall rule over them in the morning, And their form and beauty shall be for Sheol to consume, So that they have no dwelling [on earth].
49.7: None of them can by any means redeem [either himself or] his brother, Nor give to God a ransom for him—
49.15: But God will redeem my life from the power of Sheol, For He will receive me. Selah.
49.20: A man [who is held] in honor, Yet who lacks [spiritual] understanding and a teachable heart, is like the beasts that perish.
49.6: Even those who trust in and rely on their wealth And boast of the abundance of their riches?
49.4: I will incline my ear and consent to a proverb; On the lyre I will unfold my riddle.
49.19: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; They shall never again see the light.
49.13: This is the fate of those who are foolishly confident, And of those after them who approve [and are influenced by] their words. Selah.

116.16: O LORD, truly I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid; You have unfastened my chains.
116.3: The cords and sorrows of death encompassed me, And the terrors of Sheol came upon me; I found distress and sorrow.
116.5: Gracious is the LORD, and [consistently] righteous; Yes, our God is compassionate.
116.18: I will pay my vows to the LORD, Yes, in the presence of all His people,
116.12: What will I give to the LORD [in return] For all His benefits toward me? [How can I repay Him for His precious blessings?]
116.10: I believed [and clung to my God] when I said, "I am greatly afflicted."
116.2: Because He has inclined His ear to me, Therefore I will call on Him as long as I live.
116.8: For You have rescued my life from death, My eyes from tears, And my feet from stumbling and falling.
116.17: I will offer to You the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call on the name of the LORD.
116.11: I said in my alarm, "All men are liars."
116.1: I love the LORD, because He hears [and continues to hear] My voice and my supplications (my pleas, my cries, my specific needs).
116.9: I will walk [in submissive wonder] before the LORD In the land of the living.
116.14: I will pay my vows to the LORD, Yes, in the presence of all His people.
116.7: Return to your rest, O my soul, For the LORD has dealt bountifully with you.
116.15: Precious [and of great consequence] in the sight of the LORD Is the death of His godly ones [so He watches over them].
116.6: The LORD protects the simple (childlike); I was brought low [humbled and discouraged], and He saved me.
116.4: Then I called on the name of the LORD: "O LORD, please save my life!"
116.19: In the courts of the Lord's house (temple)— In the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
116.13: I will lift up the cup of salvation And call on the name of the LORD.

81.16: "But I would feed Israel with the finest of the wheat; And with honey from the rock I would satisfy you."
81.3: Blow the trumpet at the New Moon, At the full moon, on our feast day.
81.5: He established it for a testimony in Joseph When He went throughout the land of Egypt. I heard the language [of One whom] I did not know, saying,
81.12: "So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their heart, To walk in [the path of] their own counsel.
81.10: "I am the LORD your God, Who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
81.2: Raise a song, sound the timbrel, The sweet sounding lyre with the harp.
81.8: "Hear, O My people, and I will admonish you— O Israel, if you would listen to Me!
81.11: "But My people would not listen to My voice, And Israel did not [consent to] obey Me.
81.1: To the Chief Musician; set to the Philistine lute. A Psalm of Asaph. Sing aloud to God our strength; Shout for joy to the God of Jacob (Israel).
81.9: "Let there be no strange god among you, Nor shall you worship any foreign god.
81.14: "Then I would quickly subdue and humble their enemies And turn My hand against their adversaries;
81.7: "You called in [the time of] trouble and I rescued you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
81.15: Those who hate the LORD would pretend obedience to Him and cringe before Him, And their time of punishment would be forever.
81.6: "I removed the burden from his shoulder; His hands were freed from the basket.
81.4: For this is a statute for Israel, An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
81.13: "Oh, that My people would listen to Me, That Israel would walk in My ways!

125.2: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, So the LORD surrounds His people From this time forth and forever.
125.4: Do good, O LORD, to those who are good And to those who are upright in their hearts.
125.5: But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways [in unresponsiveness to God], The LORD will lead them away with those who do evil. Peace be upon Israel.
125.1: A Song of Ascents. Those who trust in and rely on the LORD [with confident expectation] Are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but remains forever.
125.3: For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest on the land of the righteous, So that the righteous will not reach out their hands to do wrong.

113.7: He raises the poor out of the dust And lifts the needy from the ash heap,
113.9: He makes the barren woman live in the house As a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
113.3: From the rising of the sun to its setting The name of the LORD is to be praised [with awe-inspired reverence].
113.2: Blessed be the name of the LORD From this time forth and forever.
113.1: Praise the LORD! ( Hallelujah!) Praise, O servants of the LORD, Praise the name of the LORD.
113.4: The LORD is high above all nations, And His glory above the heavens.
113.6: Who humbles Himself to regard The heavens and the earth?
113.5: Who is like the LORD our God, Who is enthroned on high,
113.8: That He may seat them with princes, With the princes of His people.

3.7: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God! For You have struck all my enemies on the cheek; You have shattered the teeth of the wicked.
3.3: But You, O LORD, are a shield for me, My glory [and my honor], and the One who lifts my head.
3.2: Many are saying of me, "There is no help [no salvation] for him in God." Selah.
3.1: A Psalm of David. When he fled from Absalom his son. O LORD, how my enemies have increased! Many are rising up against me.
3.4: With my voice I was crying to the LORD, And He answered me from His holy mountain. Selah.
3.6: I will not be intimidated or afraid of the ten thousands Who have set themselves against me all around.
3.5: I lay down and slept [safely]; I awakened, for the LORD sustains me.
3.8: Salvation belongs to the LORD; May Your blessing be upon Your people. Selah.

75.7: But God is the Judge; He puts down one and lifts up another.
75.9: But as for me, I will declare it and rejoice forever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75.10: All the horns of the wicked He will cut off, But the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.
75.3: "The earth and all the inhabitants of it melt [in tumultuous times]. It is I who will steady its pillars. Selah.
75.2: "When I select an appointed time, I will judge with equity," [says the LORD].
75.1: To the Chief Musician; set to [the tune of] "Do Not Destroy." A Psalm of Asaph. A Song. We give thanks and praise to You, O God, we give thanks, For Your [wonderful works declare that Your] name is near; People declare Your wonders.
75.4: "I said to the arrogant, 'Do not boast;' And to the wicked, 'Do not lift up the horn [of self-glorification].
75.6: For not from the east, nor from the west, Nor from the desert comes exaltation.
75.5: 'Do not lift up your [defiant and aggressive] horn on high, Do not speak with a stiff neck.'"
75.8: For a cup [of His wrath] is in the hand of the LORD, and the wine foams; It is well mixed and fully spiced, and He pours out from it; And all the wicked of the earth must drain it and drink down to its dregs.

94.16: Who will stand up for me against the evildoers? Who will take a stand for me against those who do wickedness?
94.3: O LORD, how long will the wicked, How long will the wicked rejoice in triumph?
94.5: They crush Your people, O LORD, And afflict and abuse Your heritage.
94.21: They band themselves together against the life of the righteous And condemn the innocent to death.
94.18: If I say, "My foot has slipped," Your compassion and lovingkindness, O LORD, will hold me up.
94.12: Blessed [with wisdom and prosperity] is the man whom You discipline and instruct, O LORD, And whom You teach from Your law,
94.10: He who instructs the nations, Does He not rebuke and punish, He who teaches man knowledge?
94.2: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; Give to the proud a fitting compensation.
94.22: But the LORD has become my high tower and defense, And my God the rock of my refuge.
94.8: Consider thoughtfully, you senseless (stupid ones) among the people; And you [dull-minded] fools, when will you become wise and understand?
94.17: If the LORD had not been my help, I would soon have dwelt in [the land of] silence.
94.11: The LORD knows the thoughts of man, That they are a mere breath (vain, empty, futile).
94.1: O LORD God, You to whom vengeance belongs, O God, You to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth [in judgment]!
94.9: He who made the ear, does He not hear? He who formed the eye, does He not see?
94.14: For the LORD will not abandon His people, Nor will He abandon His inheritance.
94.7: Yet they say, "The LORD does not see, Nor does the God of Jacob (Israel) notice it."
94.15: For judgment will again be righteous, And all the upright in heart will follow it.
94.20: Can a throne of destruction be allied with You, One which frames and devises mischief by decree [under the sacred name of law]?
94.23: He has turned back their own wickedness upon them And will destroy them by means of their own evil; The LORD our God will wipe them out.
94.6: They kill the widow and the alien And murder the fatherless.
94.4: They pour out words, speaking arrogant things; All who do evil boast proudly.
94.19: When my anxious thoughts multiply within me, Your comforts delight me.
94.13: That You may grant him [power to calm himself and find] peace in the days of adversity, Until the pit is dug for the wicked and ungodly.

101.7: He who practices deceit will not dwell in my house; He who tells lies and half-truths will not continue [to remain] in my presence.
101.3: I will set no worthless or wicked thing before my eyes. I hate the practice of those who fall away [from the right path]; It will not grasp hold of me.
101.2: I will behave wisely and follow the way of integrity. When will You come to me? I will walk in my house in integrity and with a blameless heart.
101.1: A Psalm of David. I will sing of [steadfast] lovingkindness and justice; To You, O LORD, I will sing praises.
101.4: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not tolerate evil.
101.6: My eyes will be on the faithful (honorable) of the land, that they may dwell with me; He who walks blamelessly is the one who will minister to and serve me.
101.5: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, him I will silence; The one who has a haughty look and a proud (arrogant) heart I will not tolerate.
101.8: Morning after morning I will destroy all the wicked in the land, That I may cut off from the city of the LORD all those who do evil.

85.3: You have withdrawn all Your wrath, You have turned away from Your burning anger.
85.5: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger to all generations?
85.12: Indeed, the LORD will give what is good, And our land will yield its produce.
85.10: Steadfast love and truth and faithfulness meet together; Righteousness and peace kiss each other.
85.2: You have forgiven the wickedness of Your people; You have covered all their sin. Selah.
85.8: I will hear [with expectant hope] what God the LORD will say, For He will speak peace to His people, to His godly ones— But let them not turn again to folly.
85.11: Truth springs from the earth, And righteousness looks down from heaven.
85.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. O LORD, You have [at last] shown favor to Your land [of Canaan]; You have restored [from Babylon] the captives of Jacob (Israel).
85.9: Surely His salvation is near to those who [reverently] fear Him [and obey Him with submissive wonder], That glory [the manifest presence of God] may dwell in our land.
85.7: Show us Your lovingkindness, O LORD, And grant us Your salvation.
85.6: Will You not revive us and bring us to life again, That Your people may rejoice in You?
85.4: Restore us, O God of our salvation, And cause Your indignation toward us to cease.
85.13: Righteousness will go before Him And will make His footsteps into a way [in which to walk].

146.7: Who executes justice for the oppressed, Who gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets free the prisoners.
146.9: The LORD protects the strangers; He supports the fatherless and the widow; But He makes crooked the way of the wicked.
146.10: The LORD shall reign forever, Your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
146.3: Do not trust in princes, In mortal man, in whom there is no salvation (help).
146.2: While I live I will praise the LORD; I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.
146.1: Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!) Praise the LORD, O my soul!
146.4: When his spirit leaves him, he returns to the earth; In that very day his thoughts and plans perish.
146.6: Who made heaven and earth, The sea, and all that is in them, Who keeps truth and is faithful forever,

32.7: You are my hiding place; You, LORD, protect me from trouble; You surround me with songs and shouts of deliverance. Selah.

139.11: If I say, "Surely the darkness will cover me, And the night will be the only light around me,"
139.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. O LORD, you have searched me [thoroughly] and have known me.
139.9: If I take the wings of the dawn, If I dwell in the remotest part of the sea,
139.24: And see if there is any wicked or hurtful way in me, And lead me in the everlasting way.
139.14: I will give thanks and praise to You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; Wonderful are Your works, And my soul knows it very well.
139.7: Where can I go from Your Spirit? Or where can I flee from Your presence?
139.15: My frame was not hidden from You, When I was being formed in secret, And intricately and skillfully formed [as if embroidered with many colors] in the depths of the earth.

139.23: Search me [thoroughly], O God, and know my heart; Test me and know my anxious thoughts;
139.6: Such [infinite] knowledge is too wonderful for me; It is too high [above me], I cannot reach it.

112.7: He will not fear bad news; His heart is steadfast, trusting [confidently relying on and believing] in the LORD.

48.3: God, in her palaces, Has made Himself known as a stronghold.

42.7: Deep calls to deep at the [thundering] sound of Your waterfalls; All Your breakers and Your waves have rolled over me.

42.3: My tears have been my food day and night, While they say to me all day long, "Where is your God?"
42.11: Why are you in despair, O my soul? Why have you become restless and disquieted within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall yet praise Him, The help of my countenance and my God.

42.1: To the Chief Musician. A skillful song, or a didactic or reflective poem, of the sons of Korah. As the deer pants [longingly] for the water brooks, So my soul pants [longingly] for You, O God.

130.7: O Israel, hope in the LORD; For with the LORD there is lovingkindness, And with Him is abundant redemption.

65.3: Wickedness and guilt prevail against me; Yet as for our transgressions, You forgive them [removing them from Your sight].

35.11: Malicious witnesses rise up; They ask me of things that I do not know.

35.20: For they do not speak peace, But they devise deceitful words [half-truths and lies] against those who are quiet in the land.

35.17: LORD, how long will You look on [without action]? Rescue my life from their destructions, My only life from the young lions.

35.1: A Psalm of David. Contend, O LORD, with those who contend with me; Fight against those who fight against me.
35.5: Let them be [blown away] like chaff before the wind [worthless, without substance], With the angel of the LORD driving them on.
35.4: Let those be ashamed and dishonored who seek my life; Let those be turned back [in defeat] and humiliated who plot evil against me.
35.8: Let destruction come upon my enemy by surprise; Let the net he hid for me catch him; Into that very destruction let him fall.
35.26: Let those be ashamed and humiliated together who rejoice at my distress; Let those be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves over me.
35.14: I behaved as if grieving for my friend or my brother; I bowed down in mourning, as one who sorrows for his mother.
35.22: You have seen this, O LORD; do not keep silent. O Lord, do not be far from me.

35.9: Then my soul shall rejoice in the LORD; It shall rejoice in His salvation.

35.24: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to Your righteousness and justice; And do not let them rejoice over me.

60.7: "Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim is My helmet; Judah is My scepter.

60.1: To the Chief Musician; set to [the tune of] "The Lily of the Testimony." A Mikhtam of David [intended to record memorable thoughts and] to teach; when he struggled with the Arameans of Mesopotamia and the Arameans of Zobah, and when Joab returned and struck twelve thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt. O God, You have rejected us and cast us off. You have broken [down our defenses and scattered] us; You have been angry; O restore us and turn again to us.

34.16: The face of the LORD is against those who do evil, To cut off the memory of them from the earth.

104.11: They give drink to every beast of the field; The wild donkeys quench their thirst there.

104.5: He established the earth on its foundations, So that it will not be moved forever and ever.

28.7: The LORD is my strength and my [impenetrable] shield; My heart trusts [with unwavering confidence] in Him, and I am helped; Therefore my heart greatly rejoices, And with my song I shall thank Him and praise Him.

28.1: A Psalm of David. To you I call, O LORD, My rock, do not be deaf to me, For if You are silent to me, I will become like those who go down to the pit (grave).

50.16: But to the wicked God says: "What right have you to recite My statutes Or to take My covenant on your lips?

50.18: "When you see a thief, you are pleased with him and condone his behavior, And you associate with adulterers.
