68.14: When the Almighty scattered [the Canaanite] kings in the land of Canaan, It was snowing on Zalmon.
68.22: The Lord said, "I will bring your enemies back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the [Red] Sea,
68.28: Your God has commanded your strength [your power in His service and your resistance to temptation]; Show Yourself strong, O God, who acted on our behalf.
68.25: The singers go in front, the players of instruments last; Between them the maidens playing on tambourines.
68.9: You, O God, sent abroad plentiful rain; You confirmed Your inheritance when it was parched and weary.
68.33: To Him who rides in the highest heavens, the ancient heavens, Behold, He sends out His voice, a mighty and majestic voice.
68.15: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; A [high] mountain of many summits is Mount Bashan [rising east of the Jordan].
68.34: Ascribe strength to God; His majesty is over Israel And His strength is in the skies.
68.21: Surely God will shatter the head of His enemies, The hairy scalp of one who goes on in his guilty ways.
68.24: They have seen Your [solemn] procession, O God, The procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary [in holiness].
68.16: Why do you look with envy, mountains with many peaks, At the mountain [of the city of Zion] which God has desired for His dwelling place? Yes, the LORD will dwell there forever.
68.35: O God, You are awesome and profoundly majestic from Your sanctuary; The God of Israel gives strength and power to His people. Blessed be God!
68.32: Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth, Sing praises to the Lord! Selah.
68.7: O God, when You went out before Your people, When You marched through the wilderness, Selah.
68.2: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away; As wax melts before the fire, So let the wicked and guilty perish before [the presence of] God.
68.6: God makes a home for the lonely; He leads the prisoners into prosperity, Only the stubborn and rebellious dwell in a parched land.
68.31: Princes and envoys shall come from Egypt; Ethiopia will quickly stretch out her hands [with the offerings of submission] to God.

143.7: Answer me quickly, O LORD, my spirit fails; Do not hide Your face from me, Or I will become like those who go down into the pit (grave).
143.9: Rescue me, O LORD, from my enemies; I take refuge in You.
143.10: Teach me to do Your will [so that I may please You], For You are my God; Let Your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
143.3: For the enemy has persecuted me, He has crushed my life down to the ground; He has made me dwell in dark places, like those who have been long dead.
143.11: Save my life, O LORD, for Your name's sake; In Your righteousness bring my life out of trouble.
143.2: And do not enter into judgment with Your servant, For in Your sight no man living is righteous or justified.
143.1: A Psalm of David. Hear my prayer, O LORD, Listen to my supplications! Answer me in Your faithfulness, and in Your righteousness.
143.12: In your lovingkindness, silence and destroy my enemies And destroy all those who afflict my life, For I am Your servant.
143.4: Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed and weak within me [wrapped in darkness]; My heart grows numb within me.
143.6: I reach out my hands to You; My throat thirsts for You, as a parched land [thirsts for water]. Selah.
143.5: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all that You have done; I ponder the work of Your hands.
143.8: Let me hear Your lovingkindness in the morning, For I trust in You. Teach me the way in which I should walk, For I lift up my soul to You.

92.3: With an instrument of ten strings and with the harp, With a solemn sound on the lyre.
92.5: How great are Your works, O LORD! Your thoughts are very deep [beyond man's understanding].
92.12: The righteous will flourish like the date palm [long-lived, upright and useful]; They will grow like a cedar in Lebanon [majestic and stable].
92.10: But my horn [my emblem of strength and power] You have exalted like that of a wild ox; I am anointed with fresh oil [for Your service].
92.2: To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning And Your faithfulness by night,
92.8: But You, LORD, are on high forever.
92.11: My eye has looked on my foes; My ears hear of the evildoers who rise up against me.
92.1: A Psalm. A Song for the Sabbath day. It is a good and delightful thing to give thanks to the LORD, To sing praises to Your name, O Most High,
92.9: For behold, Your enemies, O LORD, For behold, Your enemies will perish; All who do evil will be scattered.
92.14: [Growing in grace] they will still thrive and bear fruit and prosper in old age; They will flourish and be vital and fresh [rich in trust and love and contentment];
92.7: That though the wicked sprout up like grass And all evildoers flourish, They will be destroyed forever.
92.15: [They are living memorials] to declare that the LORD is upright and faithful [to His promises]; He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
92.6: A senseless man [in his crude and uncultivated state] knows nothing, Nor does a [self-righteous] fool understand this:
92.4: For You, O LORD, have made me glad by Your works; At the works of Your hands I joyfully sing.
92.13: Planted in the house of the LORD, They will flourish in the courts of our God.

118.11: They encompassed me, yes, they surrounded me [on every side]; In the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
118.3: Oh let the house of Aaron say, "His lovingkindness endures forever."
118.20: This is the gate of the LORD; The righteous will enter through it.
118.12: They swarmed around me like bees; They flare up and are extinguished like a fire of thorns; In the name of the LORD I will surely cut them off.
118.10: All nations encompassed me; In the name of the LORD I will surely cut them off.
118.17: I will not die, but live, And declare the works and recount the illustrious acts of the LORD.
118.13: You [my enemy] pushed me violently so that I was falling, But the LORD helped me.
118.27: The LORD is God, and He has given us light [illuminating us with His grace and freedom and joy]. Bind the festival sacrifices with cords to the horns of the altar.
118.18: The LORD has disciplined me severely, But He has not given me over to death.
118.29: O give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; For His lovingkindness endures forever.
118.23: This is from the LORD and is His doing; It is marvelous in our eyes.
118.19: Open to me the [temple] gates of righteousness; I shall enter through them, I shall give thanks to the LORD.
118.1: O give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; For His lovingkindness endures forever.
118.5: Out of my distress I called on the LORD; The LORD answered me and set me free.
118.4: Oh let those who [reverently] fear the LORD, say, "His lovingkindness endures forever."
118.8: It is better to take refuge in the LORD Than to trust in man.
118.26: Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the LORD; We have blessed you from the house of the LORD [you who come into His sanctuary under His guardianship].
118.14: The LORD is my strength and song, And He has become my salvation.
118.22: The stone which the builders rejected Has become the chief corner stone.
118.28: You are my God, and I give thanks to You; [You are] my God, I extol You.
118.25: O LORD, save now, we beseech You; O LORD, we beseech You, send now prosperity and give us success!
118.9: It is better to take refuge in the LORD Than to trust in princes.
118.15: The sound of joyful shouting and salvation is in the tents of the righteous: The right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.21: I will give thanks to You, for You have heard and answered me; And You have become my salvation [my Rescuer, my Savior].
118.24: This [day in which God has saved me] is the day which the LORD has made; Let us rejoice and be glad in it.
118.16: The right hand of the LORD is exalted; The right hand of the LORD does valiantly.
118.7: The LORD is on my side, He is among those who help me; Therefore I will look [in triumph] on those who hate me.
118.2: Oh let Israel say, "His lovingkindness endures forever."
118.6: The LORD is on my side; I will not fear. What can [mere] man do to me?

18.11: He made darkness His hiding place (covering); His pavilion (canopy) around Him, The darkness of the waters, the thick clouds of the skies.
18.41: They cried for help, but there was no one to save them— Even to the LORD [they cried], but He did not answer them.
18.45: Foreigners lose heart, And come trembling out of their strongholds.
18.42: Then I beat them fine as the dust before the wind; I emptied them out as the dirt of the streets.
18.3: I call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised; And I am saved from my enemies.
18.20: The LORD dealt with me according to my righteousness (moral character, spiritual integrity); According to the cleanness of my hands He has rewarded me.
18.12: Out of the brightness before Him passed His thick clouds, Hailstones and coals of fire.
18.10: And He rode upon a cherub (storm) and flew; And He sped on the wings of the wind.
18.17: He rescued me from my strong enemy, And from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.
18.44: As soon as they hear me, they respond and obey me; Foreigners feign obedience to me.
18.40: You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me [in defeat], And I silenced and destroyed those who hated me.
18.13: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, And the Most High uttered His voice, Hailstones and coals of fire.
18.27: For You save an afflicted and humble people, But bring down those [arrogant fools] with haughty eyes.
18.30: As for God, His way is blameless. The word of the LORD is tested [it is perfect, it is faultless]; He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.
18.18: They confronted me in the day of my disaster, But the LORD was my support.
18.36: You enlarge the path beneath me and make my steps secure, So that my feet will not slip.
18.29: For by You I can crush a troop, And by my God I can leap over a wall.
18.23: I was blameless before Him, And I kept myself free from my sin.
18.19: He brought me out into a broad place; He rescued me because He was pleased with me and delighted in me.
18.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David, the servant of the LORD, who spoke the words of this song to the LORD on the day when the LORD rescued him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. And he said: "I love You [fervently and devotedly], O LORD, my strength."
18.47: The God who avenges me, And subdues peoples (nations) under me.
18.5: The cords of Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead) surrounded me; The snares of death confronted me.
18.49: Therefore will I give thanks and praise You, O LORD, among the nations, And sing praises to Your name.
18.4: The cords of death surrounded me, And the streams of ungodliness and torrents of destruction terrified me.
18.8: Smoke went up from His nostrils, And fire from His mouth devoured; Coals were kindled by it.
18.26: With the pure You show Yourself pure, And with the crooked You show Yourself astute.
18.39: For You have encircled me with strength for the battle; You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
18.14: He sent out His arrows and scattered them; And He sent an abundance of lightning flashes and confused and routed them [in defeat].
18.37: I pursued my enemies and overtook them; And I did not turn back until they were consumed.
18.22: For all His ordinances were before me, And I did not put away His statutes from me.
18.28: For You cause my lamp to be lighted and to shine; The LORD my God illumines my darkness.
18.25: With the kind (merciful, faithful, loyal) You show Yourself kind, With the blameless You show Yourself blameless,
18.9: He bowed the heavens also and came down; And thick darkness was under His feet.
18.33: He makes my feet like hinds' feet [able to stand firmly and tread safely on paths of testing and trouble]; He sets me [securely] upon my high places.
18.15: Then the stream beds of the waters appeared, And the foundations of the world were laid bare At Your rebuke, O LORD, At the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
18.34: He trains my hands for war, So that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
18.21: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, And have not wickedly departed from my God.
18.24: Therefore the LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness (moral character, spiritual integrity), According to the cleanness of my hands in His sight.
18.46: The LORD lives, blessed be my rock; And may the God of my salvation be exalted,
18.16: He reached from on high, He took me; He drew me out of many waters.
18.35: You have also given me the shield of Your salvation, And Your right hand upholds and sustains me; Your gentleness [Your gracious response when I pray] makes me great.
18.32: The God who encircles me with strength And makes my way blameless?
18.7: Then the earth shook and quaked, The foundations of the mountains trembled; They were shaken because He was indignant and angry.
18.43: You have rescued me from the contentions of the people; You have placed me as the head of the nations; A people whom I have not known serve me.
18.48: He rescues me from my enemies; Yes, You lift me up above those who rise up against me; You deliver me from the man of violence.
18.2: The LORD is my rock, my fortress, and the One who rescues me; My God, my rock and strength in whom I trust and take refuge; My shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower—my stronghold.
18.38: I shattered them so that they were not able to rise; They fell [wounded] under my feet.
18.50: He gives great triumphs to His king, And shows steadfast love and mercy to His anointed, To David and his descendants forever.
18.6: In my distress [when I seemed surrounded] I called upon the LORD And cried to my God for help; He heard my voice from His temple, And my cry for help came before Him, into His very ears.
18.31: For who is God, but the LORD? Or who is a rock, except our God,

90.16: Let Your work [the signs of Your power] be revealed to Your servants And Your [glorious] majesty to their children.
90.3: You turn man back to dust, And say, "Return [to the earth], O children of [mortal] men!"
90.5: You have swept them away like a flood, they fall asleep [forgotten as soon as they are gone]; In the morning they are like grass which grows anew—
90.12: So teach us to number our days, That we may cultivate and bring to You a heart of wisdom.
90.10: The days of our life are seventy years— Or even, if because of strength, eighty years; Yet their pride [in additional years] is only labor and sorrow, For it is soon gone and we fly away.
90.2: Before the mountains were born Or before You had given birth to the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, You are [the eternal] God.
90.8: You have placed our wickedness before you, Our secret sins [which we tried to conceal, You have placed] in the [revealing] light of Your presence.
90.17: And let the [gracious] favor of the Lord our God be on us; Confirm for us the work of our hands— Yes, confirm the work of our hands.
90.11: Who understands the power of Your anger? [Who connects this brevity of life among us with Your judgment of sin?] And Your wrath, [who connects it] with the [reverent] fear that is due You?
90.1: A Prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, You have been our dwelling place [our refuge, our sanctuary, our stability] in all generations.
90.9: For all our days pass away in Your wrath; We have finished our years like a whispered sigh.
90.14: O satisfy us with Your lovingkindness in the morning [now, before we grow older], That we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
90.7: For we have been consumed by Your anger And by Your wrath we have been terrified.
90.15: Make us glad in proportion to the days You have afflicted us, And the years we have suffered evil.
90.6: In the morning it flourishes and springs up; In the evening it wilts and withers away.
90.4: For a thousand years in Your sight Are like yesterday when it is past, Or as a watch in the night.
90.13: Turn, O LORD [from Your fierce anger]; how long will it be? Be compassionate toward Your servants—revoke Your sentence.

135.16: They have mouths, but they do not speak; They have eyes, but they do not see;
135.3: Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; Sing praises to His name, for it is gracious and lovely.
135.5: For I know that the LORD is great And that our Lord is above all gods.
135.21: Blessed be the LORD from Zion, Who dwells [with us] at Jerusalem. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
135.18: Those who make idols are like them [absolutely worthless—spiritually blind, deaf, and powerless]; So is everyone who trusts in and relies on them.
135.12: And He gave their land as a heritage, A heritage to Israel His people.
135.10: Who struck many nations And killed mighty kings,
135.2: You who stand in the house of the LORD, In the courts of the house of our God,
135.8: Who struck the firstborn of Egypt, Both of man and animal;
135.17: They have ears, but they do not hear, Nor is there any breath in their mouths.
135.11: Sihon, king of the Amorites, Og, king of Bashan, And all the kingdoms of Canaan;
135.1: Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!) Praise the name of the LORD; Praise Him, O servants of the LORD (priests, Levites),
135.9: Who sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, Upon Pharaoh and all his servants.
135.14: For the LORD will judge His people And He will have compassion on His servants [revealing His mercy].
135.7: Who causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth; Who makes lightning for the rain, Who brings the wind from His storehouses;
135.15: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, The work of men's hands.
135.20: O house of Levi, bless the LORD; You who fear the LORD [and worship Him with obedience], bless the LORD [with grateful praise]!
135.6: Whatever the LORD pleases, He does, In the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all deeps—
135.4: For the LORD has chosen [the descendants of] Jacob for Himself, Israel for His own special treasure and possession.
135.19: O house of Israel, bless and praise the LORD [with gratitude]; O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;
135.13: Your name, O LORD, endures forever, Your fame and remembrance, O LORD, [endures] throughout all generations.

56.3: When I am afraid, I will put my trust and faith in You.
56.5: All day long they twist my words and say hurtful things; All their thoughts are against me for evil.
56.12: Your vows are binding upon me, O God; I will give thank offerings to You.
56.10: In God, whose word I praise, In the LORD, whose word I praise,
56.2: My enemies have trampled upon me all day long, For they are many who fight proudly against me.
56.8: You have taken account of my wanderings; Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not recorded in Your book?
56.11: In God have I put my trust and confident reliance; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
56.1: To the Chief Musician; set to [the tune of] "Silent Dove Among Those Far Away." A Mikhtam of David. [A record of memorable thoughts] when the Philistines seized him in Gath. Be gracious to me, O God, for man has trampled on me; All day long the adversary oppresses and torments me.
56.9: Then my enemies will turn back in the day when I call; This I know, that God is for me.
56.7: Cast them out because of their wickedness. In anger bring down the peoples, O God!
56.6: They attack, they hide and lurk, They watch my steps, As they have [expectantly] waited to take my life.
56.4: In God, whose word I praise; In God I have put my trust; I shall not fear. What can mere man do to me?
56.13: For You have rescued my soul from death, Yes, and my feet from stumbling, So that I may walk before God In the light of life.

150.3: Praise Him with trumpet sound; Praise Him with harp and lyre.
150.2: Praise Him for His mighty acts; Praise Him according to [the abundance of] His greatness.
150.1: Praise the LORD! Praise God in His sanctuary; Praise Him in His mighty heavens.
150.4: Praise Him with tambourine and dancing; Praise Him with stringed instruments and flute.
150.6: Let everything that has breath and every breath of life praise the LORD! Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
150.5: Praise Him with resounding cymbals; Praise Him with loud cymbals.

83.16: Fill their faces with shame and disgrace, That they may [persistently] seek Your name, O LORD.
83.3: They concoct crafty schemes against Your people, And conspire together against Your hidden and precious ones.
83.5: For they have conspired together with one mind; Against You they make a covenant—
83.18: That they may know that You alone, whose name is the LORD, Are the Most High over all the earth.
83.12: Who said, "Let us possess for ourselves The pastures of God."
83.10: Who were destroyed at En-dor, Who became like dung for the earth.
83.2: For behold, Your enemies are in tumult, And those who hate You have raised their heads [in hatred of You].
83.8: Assyria also has joined with them; They have helped the children of Lot [the Ammonites and the Moabites] and have been an arm [of strength] to them. Selah.
83.17: Let them be ashamed and dismayed forever; Yes, let them be humiliated and perish,
83.11: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb And all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.1: A Song. A Psalm of Asaph. Do not keep silent, O God; Do not hold Your peace or be still, O God.
83.9: Deal with them as [You did] with Midian, As with Sisera and Jabin at the brook of Kishon,
83.14: Like fire consumes the forest, And like the flame sets the mountains on fire,
83.7: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre.
83.15: So pursue them with Your tempest And terrify them with [the violence of] Your storm.
83.6: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Of Moab and the Hagrites,
83.4: They have said, "Come, and let us wipe them out as a nation; Let the name of Israel be remembered no more."
83.13: O my God, make them like whirling dust, Like chaff before the wind [worthless and without substance].

141.7: As when the one plows and breaks open the ground [and the soil scatters behind him], Our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol [by the injustices of the wicked].
141.9: Keep me from the jaws of the trap which they have set for me, And from the snares of those who do evil.
141.10: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, While I pass by and safely escape [from danger].
141.3: Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth; Keep watch over the door of my lips [to keep me from speaking thoughtlessly].
141.2: Let my prayer be counted as incense before You; The lifting up of my hands as the evening offering.
141.1: A Psalm of David. LORD, I call upon You; hurry to me. Listen to my voice when I call to You.
141.4: Do not incline my heart to [consent to or tolerate] any evil thing, Or to practice deeds of wickedness With men who plan and do evil; And let me not eat of their delicacies (be tempted by their gain).
141.6: Their [wicked, godless] judges are thrown down the sides of the rocky cliff, And they [who followed them] will hear my words, for they are pleasant (just).
141.5: Let the righteous [thoughtfully] strike (correct) me—it is a kindness [done to encourage my spiritual maturity]. It is [the choicest anointing] oil on the head; Let my head not refuse [to accept and acknowledge and learn from] it; For still my prayer is against their wicked deeds.
141.8: For my eyes are toward You, O GOD, the Lord; In You I take refuge; do not pour out my life nor leave me defenseless.

71.16: I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord GOD [and in His strength]; I will make mention of Your righteousness, Yours alone.
71.3: Be to me a rock of refuge and a sheltering stronghold to which I may continually come; You have given the commandment to save me, For You are my rock and my fortress.
71.5: For You are my hope; O Lord GOD, You are my trust and the source of my confidence from my youth.
71.21: May You increase my greatness (honor) And turn to comfort me.
71.18: And even when I am old and gray-headed, O God, do not abandon me, Until I declare Your [mighty] strength to this generation, Your power to all who are to come.
71.12: O God, do not be far from me; O my God, come quickly to help me!
71.10: For my enemies have spoken against me; Those who watch for my life have consulted together,
71.2: In Your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; Incline Your ear to me and save me.
71.22: I will also praise You with the harp, Your truth and faithfulness, O my God; To You I will sing praises with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
71.8: My mouth is filled with Your praise And with Your glory all day long.
71.17: O God, You have taught me from my youth, And I still declare Your wondrous works and miraculous deeds.
71.11: Saying, "God has abandoned him; Pursue and seize him, for there is no one to rescue him."
71.1: In you, O LORD, I have put my trust and confidently taken refuge; Let me never be put to shame.
71.9: Do not cast me off nor send me away in the time of old age; Do not abandon me when my strength fails and I am weak.
71.24: My tongue also will speak of Your righteousness all day long; For they are ashamed, for they are humiliated who seek my injury.
71.14: But as for me, I will wait and hope continually, And will praise You yet more and more.
71.7: I am as a wonder to many, For You are my strong refuge.
71.15: My mouth shall tell of Your righteousness And of Your [deeds of] salvation all day long, For their number is more than I know.
71.20: You who have shown me many troubles and distresses Will revive and renew me again, And will bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
71.23: My lips will shout for joy when I sing praises to You, And my soul, which You have redeemed.
71.6: Upon You have I relied and been sustained from my birth; You are He who took me from my mother's womb and You have been my benefactor from that day. My praise is continually of You.
71.4: Rescue me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked (godless), From the grasp of the unrighteous and ruthless man.
71.19: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the [height of the] heavens, You who have done great things; O God, who is like You, [who is Your equal]?
71.13: Let those who attack my life be ashamed and consumed; Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor, who seek to injure me.

11.7: For the LORD is [absolutely] righteous, He loves righteousness (virtue, morality, justice); The upright shall see His face.
11.3: "If the foundations [of a godly society] are destroyed, What can the righteous do?"
11.2: For look, the wicked are bending the bow; They take aim with their arrow on the string To shoot [by stealth] in darkness at the upright in heart.
11.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. In the LORD I take refuge [and put my trust]; How can you say to me, "Flee like a bird to your mountain;
11.4: The LORD is in His holy temple; the Lord's throne is in heaven. His eyes see, His eyelids test the children of men.
11.6: Upon the wicked (godless) He will rain coals of fire; Fire and brimstone and a dreadful scorching wind will be the portion of their cup [of doom].
11.5: The LORD tests the righteous and the wicked, And His soul hates the [malevolent] one who loves violence.

105.11: Saying, "To you I will give the land of Canaan As the measured portion of your inheritance."
105.41: He opened the rock and water flowed out; It ran in the dry places like a river.
105.45: So that they might observe His precepts And keep His laws [obediently accepting and honoring and valuing them]. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
105.42: For He remembered His holy word To Abraham His servant;
105.3: Glory in His holy name; Let the hearts of those who seek and require the LORD [as their most essential need] rejoice.
105.20: The king sent and released him, The ruler of the peoples [of Egypt], and set him free.
105.12: When there were only a few men in number, Very few [in fact], and strangers in it;
105.10: Which He confirmed to Jacob as a statute, To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
105.17: He sent a man before them, Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.44: He gave them the lands of the nations [of Canaan], So that they would possess the fruits of those peoples' labor,
105.40: The Israelites asked, and He brought quail, And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
105.13: And they wandered from one nation to another, From one kingdom to another people,
105.27: They exhibited His wondrous signs among them, Great miracles in the land of Ham (Egypt).
105.30: Their land swarmed with frogs, Even in the chambers of their kings.
105.18: His feet they hurt with shackles;  He was put in chains of iron,
105.36: He also struck down all the firstborn in their land, The first fruits and chief substance of all their strength.
105.29: He turned Egypt's waters into blood And caused their fish to die.
105.23: Israel also came into Egypt; Thus Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
105.19: Until the time that his word [of prophecy regarding his brothers] came true, The word of the LORD tested and refined him.
105.1: O give thanks to the LORD, call upon His name; Make known His deeds among the people.
105.5: Remember [with awe and gratitude] the wonderful things which He has done, His amazing deeds and the judgments uttered by His mouth [on His enemies, as in Egypt],
105.4: Seek and deeply long for the LORD and His strength [His power, His might]; Seek and deeply long for His face and His presence continually.
105.8: He has remembered His covenant forever, The word which He commanded and established to a thousand generations,
105.26: He sent Moses His servant, And Aaron, whom He had chosen.
105.39: The LORD spread a cloud as a covering [by day], And a fire to illumine the night.
105.14: He allowed no man to oppress them; He rebuked kings for their sakes, saying,
105.37: He brought the sons of Israel out [of Egypt] with silver and gold, And among their tribes there was not one who stumbled.
105.22: To imprison his princes at his will, That he might teach his elders wisdom.
105.28: He sent [thick, oppressive] darkness and made the land dark; And Moses and Aaron did not rebel against His words.
105.25: He turned the heart [of the Egyptians] to hate His people, To deal craftily with His servants.
105.9: The covenant which He made with Abraham, And His sworn oath to Isaac,
105.33: He struck their vines also and their fig trees, And shattered the [ice-laden] trees of their territory.
105.15: "Do not touch My anointed ones, And do My prophets no harm."
105.34: He spoke, and the [migratory] locusts came, And the young locusts, even without number,
105.21: He made Joseph lord of his house And ruler of all his possessions,
105.24: There the LORD greatly increased [the number of] His people, And made them more powerful than their enemies.
105.16: And He called for a famine upon the land [of Egypt]; He cut off every source of bread.
105.35: And ate up all the vegetation in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.
105.32: He gave them hail for rain, With flaming fire in their land.
105.7: He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
105.43: He brought out His people with joy, And His chosen ones with a joyful shout,
105.2: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; Speak of all His wonderful acts and devoutly praise them.
105.38: Egypt was glad when they departed, For the dread and fear of them had fallen on the Egyptians.
105.6: O you offspring of Abraham, His servant, O you sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
105.31: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies And gnats in all their territory.

16.7: I will bless the LORD who has counseled me; Indeed, my heart (mind) instructs me in the night.
16.9: Therefore my heart is glad and my glory [my innermost self] rejoices; My body too will dwell [confidently] in safety,
16.10: For You will not abandon me to Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead), Nor will You allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.
16.3: As for the saints (godly people) who are in the land, They are the majestic and the noble and the excellent ones in whom is all my delight.
16.11: You will show me the path of life; In Your presence is fullness of joy; In Your right hand there are pleasures forevermore.
16.2: I said to the LORD, "You are my Lord; I have no good besides You."
16.1: A Mikhtam of David [probably intended to record memorable thoughts]. Keep and protect me, O God, for in You I have placed my trust and found refuge.
16.4: The sorrows [pain and suffering] of those who have chosen another god will be multiplied [because of their idolatry]; I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, Nor will I take their names upon my lips.
16.6: The [boundary] lines [of the land] have fallen for me in pleasant places; Indeed, my heritage is beautiful to me.
16.5: The LORD is the portion of my inheritance, my cup [He is all I need]; You support my lot.
16.8: I have set the LORD continually before me; Because He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

77.16: The waters [of the Red Sea] saw You, O God; The waters saw You, they were in anguish; The deeps also trembled.
77.3: I remember God; then I am disquieted and I groan; I sigh [in prayer], and my spirit grows faint. Selah.
77.5: I have considered the ancient days, The years [of prosperity] of long, long ago.
77.18: The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; The lightnings illumined the world; The earth trembled and shook.
77.12: I will meditate on all Your works And thoughtfully consider all Your [great and wondrous] deeds.
77.10: And I said, "This is my grief, That the right hand of the Most High has changed [and His lovingkindness is withheld]."
77.2: In the day of my trouble I [desperately] sought the Lord; In the night my hand was stretched out [in prayer] without weariness; My soul refused to be comforted.
77.8: Has His lovingkindness ceased forever? Have His promises ended for all time?
77.17: The clouds poured down water; The skies sent out a sound [of rumbling thunder]; Your arrows (lightning) flashed here and there.
77.11: I will [solemnly] remember the deeds of the LORD; Yes, I will [wholeheartedly] remember Your wonders of old.
77.1: To the Chief Musician; according to Jeduthun [one of David's three chief musicians, founder of an official musical family]. A Psalm of Asaph. My voice rises to God, and I will cry aloud; My voice rises to God, and He will hear me.
77.9: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Or has He in anger withdrawn His compassion? Selah.
77.14: You are the [awesome] God who works [powerful] wonders; You have demonstrated Your power among the people.
77.7: Will the Lord reject forever? And will He never be favorable again?
77.15: You have with Your [great] arm redeemed Your people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
77.20: You led Your people like a flock By the hand of Moses and Aaron [to the promised goal].
77.6: I will remember my song in the night; I will meditate with my heart, And my spirit searches:
77.4: You have held my eyelids open; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77.19: Your way [of escape for Your people] was through the sea, And Your paths through the great waters, And Your footprints were not traceable.
77.13: Your way, O God, is holy [far from sin and guilt]. What god is great like our God?

25.16: Turn to me [LORD] and be gracious to me, For I am alone and afflicted.
25.3: Indeed, none of those who [expectantly] wait for You will be ashamed; Those who turn away from what is right and deal treacherously without cause will be ashamed (humiliated, embarrassed).
25.5: Guide me in Your truth and teach me, For You are the God of my salvation; For You [and only You] I wait [expectantly] all the day long.
25.21: Let integrity and uprightness protect me, For I wait [expectantly] for You.
25.18: Look upon my affliction and my trouble, And forgive all my sins.
25.12: Who is the man who fears the LORD [with awe-inspired reverence and worships Him with submissive wonder]? He will teach him [through His word] in the way he should choose.
25.10: All the paths of the LORD are lovingkindness and goodness and truth and faithfulness To those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
25.2: O my God, in You I [have unwavering] trust [and I rely on You with steadfast confidence], Do not let me be ashamed or my hope in You be disappointed; Do not let my enemies triumph over me.
25.22: O God, redeem Israel, Out of all his troubles.
25.8: Good and upright is the LORD; Therefore He instructs sinners in the way.
25.17: The troubles of my heart are multiplied; Bring me out of my distresses.
25.11: For Your name's sake, O LORD, Pardon my wickedness and my guilt, for they are great.
25.1: A Psalm of David. To You, O LORD, I lift up my soul.
25.9: He leads the humble in justice, And He teaches the humble His way.
25.14: The secret [of the wise counsel] of the LORD is for those who fear Him, And He will let them know His covenant and reveal to them [through His word] its [deep, inner] meaning.
25.7: Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions; According to Your lovingkindness remember me, For Your goodness' sake, O LORD.
25.15: My eyes are continually toward the LORD, For He will bring my feet out of the net.
25.20: Guard my soul and rescue me; Do not let me be ashamed or disappointed, For I have taken refuge in You.
25.6: Remember, O LORD, Your [tender] compassion and Your lovingkindnesses, For they have been from of old.
25.4: Let me know Your ways, O LORD; Teach me Your paths.
25.19: Look upon my enemies, for they are many; They hate me with cruel and violent hatred.
25.13: His soul will dwell in prosperity and goodness, And his descendants will inherit the land.

137.7: Remember, O LORD, against the sons of Edom, The day of [the fall of] Jerusalem, Who said "Down, down [with her] To her very foundation."
137.9: How blessed will be the one who seizes and dashes your little ones Against the rock.
137.3: For there they who took us captive demanded of us a song with words, And our tormentors [who made a mockery of us demanded] amusement, saying, "Sing us one of the songs of Zion."
137.2: On the willow trees in the midst of Babylon We hung our harps.
137.1: By the rivers of Babylon, There we [captives] sat down and wept, When we remembered Zion [the city God imprinted on our hearts].
137.4: How can we sing the Lord's song In a strange and foreign land?
137.6: Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth If I do not remember you, If I do not prefer Jerusalem Above my chief joy.
137.5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget [her skill with the harp].
137.8: O daughter of Babylon, you devastator, How blessed will be the one Who repays you [with destruction] as you have repaid us.

54.7: For He has rescued me from every trouble, And my eye has looked with satisfaction (triumph) on my enemies.
54.3: For strangers have risen against me And violent men have sought my life; They have not set God before them. Selah.
54.2: Hear my prayer, O God; Listen to the words of my mouth.
54.1: To the Chief Musician; with stringed instruments. A skillful song, or a didactic or reflective poem, of David, when the Ziphites went and told Saul, "David is hiding among us." Save me, O God, by Your name; And vindicate me by Your [wondrous] power.
54.4: Behold, God is my helper and ally; The Lord is the sustainer of my soul [my upholder].
54.6: With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to You; I will give thanks and praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.
54.5: He will pay back the evil to my enemies; In Your faithfulness destroy them.

6.7: My eye grows dim with grief; It grows old because of all my enemies.
6.9: The LORD has heard my supplication [my plea for grace]; The LORD receives my prayer.
6.10: Let all my enemies be ashamed and greatly horrified; Let them turn back, let them suddenly be ashamed [of what they have done].
6.3: My soul [as well as my body] is greatly dismayed. But as for You, O LORD—how long [until You act on my behalf]?
6.2: Have mercy on me and be gracious to me, O LORD, for I am weak (faint, frail); Heal me, O LORD, for my bones are dismayed and anguished.
6.1: To the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments, set [possibly] an octave below. A Psalm of David. O LORD, do not rebuke or punish me in Your anger, Nor discipline me in Your wrath.
6.4: Return, O LORD, rescue my soul; Save me because of Your [unfailing] steadfast love and mercy.
6.6: I am weary with my groaning; Every night I soak my bed with tears, I drench my couch with my weeping.
6.5: For in death there is no mention of You; In Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead) who will praise You and give You thanks?
6.8: Depart from me, all you who do evil, For the LORD has heard the voice of my weeping.

67.7: God blesses us, And all the ends of the earth shall fear Him [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder].
67.3: Let the peoples praise You, O God; Let all the peoples praise You.
67.2: That Your way may be known on earth, Your salvation and deliverance among all nations.
67.1: To the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm. A Song. God be gracious and kind-hearted to us and bless us, And make His face shine [with favor] on us— Selah.
67.4: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, For You will judge the people fairly And guide the nations on earth. Selah.
67.6: The earth has yielded its harvest [as evidence of His approval]; God, our God, blesses us.
67.5: Let the peoples praise You, O God; Let all the peoples praise You.

40.16: Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; Let those who love Your salvation say continually, "The LORD be magnified!"
40.3: He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God; Many will see and fear [with great reverence] And will trust confidently in the LORD.
40.5: Many, O LORD my God, are the wonderful works which You have done, And Your thoughts toward us; There is none to compare with You. If I would declare and speak of your wonders, They would be too many to count.
40.12: For innumerable evils have encompassed me; My sins have overtaken me, so that I am not able to see. They are more numerous than the hairs of my head, And my heart has failed me.
40.10: I have not concealed Your righteousness within my heart; I have proclaimed Your faithfulness and Your salvation. I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth from the great assembly.
40.2: He brought me up out of a horrible pit [of tumult and of destruction], out of the miry clay, And He set my feet upon a rock, steadying my footsteps and establishing my path.
40.8: "I delight to do Your will, O my God; Your law is within my heart."
40.17: Even though I am afflicted and needy, Still the Lord takes thought and is mindful of me. You are my help and my rescuer. O my God, do not delay.
40.11: Do not withhold Your compassion and tender mercy from me, O LORD; Your lovingkindness and Your truth will continually preserve me.
40.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. I waited patiently and expectantly for the LORD; And He inclined to me and heard my cry.
40.9: I have proclaimed good news of righteousness [and the joy that comes from obedience to You] in the great assembly; Behold, I will not restrain my lips [from proclaiming Your righteousness], As You know, O LORD.
40.14: Let those be ashamed and humiliated together Who seek my life to destroy it; Let those be turned back [in defeat] and dishonored Who delight in my hurt.
40.7: Then I said, "Behold, I come [to the throne]; In the scroll of the book it is written of me.
40.15: Let those be appalled and desolate because of their shame Who say to me, "Aha, aha [rejoicing in my misfortune]!"
40.6: Sacrifice and meal offering You do not desire, nor do You delight in them; You have opened my ears and given me the capacity to hear [and obey Your word]; Burnt offerings and sin offerings You do not require.
40.4: Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the man who makes the LORD his trust, And does not regard the proud nor those who lapse into lies.
40.13: Be pleased, O LORD, to save me; O LORD, make haste to help me.

149.7: To execute vengeance on the nations And punishment on the peoples,
149.9: To execute on them the judgment written. This is the honor for all His godly ones. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
149.3: Let them praise His name with dancing; Let them sing praises to Him with the tambourine and lyre.
149.2: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker; Let Zion's children rejoice in their King.
149.1: Praise the LORD! Sing to the LORD a new song, And praise Him in the congregation of His godly ones (believers).
149.4: For the LORD takes pleasure in His people; He will beautify the humble with salvation.
149.6: Let the high praises of God be in their throats, And a two-edged sword in their hands,
149.5: Let the godly ones exult in glory; Let them sing for joy on their beds.
149.8: To bind their kings with chains And their nobles with fetters of iron,

27.3: Though an army encamp against me, My heart will not fear; Though war arise against me, Even in this I am confident.
27.5: For in the day of trouble He will hide me in His shelter; In the secret place of His tent He will hide me; He will lift me up on a rock.
27.12: Do not give me up to the will of my adversaries, For false witnesses have come against me; They breathe out violence.
27.10: Although my father and my mother have abandoned me, Yet the LORD will take me up [adopt me as His child].
27.2: When the wicked came against me to eat up my flesh, My adversaries and my enemies, they stumbled and fell.
27.8: When You said, "Seek My face [in prayer, require My presence as your greatest need]," my heart said to You, "Your face, O LORD, I will seek [on the authority of Your word]."
27.11: Teach me Your way, O LORD, And lead me on a level path Because of my enemies [who lie in wait].
27.1: A Psalm of David. The LORD is my light and my salvation— Whom shall I fear? The LORD is the refuge and fortress of my life— Whom shall I dread?
27.9: Do not hide Your face from me, Do not turn Your servant away in anger; You have been my help; Do not abandon me nor leave me, O God of my salvation!
27.14: Wait for and confidently expect the LORD; Be strong and let your heart take courage; Yes, wait for and confidently expect the LORD.
27.7: Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud; Be gracious and compassionate to me and answer me.
27.6: And now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me, In His tent I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to the LORD.
27.4: One thing I have asked of the LORD, and that I will seek: That I may dwell in the house of the LORD [in His presence] all the days of my life, To gaze upon the beauty [the delightful loveliness and majestic grandeur] of the LORD And to meditate in His temple.
27.13: I would have despaired had I not believed that I would see the goodness of the LORD In the land of the living.

30.7: By Your favor and grace, O LORD, you have made my mountain stand strong; You hid Your face, and I was horrified.
30.9: "What profit is there in my blood (death), if I go down to the pit (grave)? Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your faithfulness [to man]?
30.10: "Hear, O LORD, be gracious and show favor to me; O LORD, be my helper."
30.3: O LORD, You have brought my life up from Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead); You have kept me alive, so that I would not go down to the pit (grave).
30.11: You have turned my mourning into dancing for me; You have taken off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
30.2: O LORD my God, I cried to You for help, and You have healed me.
30.1: A Psalm; a Song at the Dedication of the House (Temple). A Psalm of David. I will extol and praise You, O LORD, for You have lifted me up, And have not let my enemies rejoice over me.
30.12: That my soul may sing praise to You and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
30.4: Sing to the LORD, O you His godly ones, And give thanks at the mention of His holy name.
30.6: As for me, in my prosperity I said, "I shall never be moved."
30.5: For His anger is but for a moment,  His favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may endure for a night, But a shout of joy comes in the morning.
30.8: I called to You, O LORD, And to the Lord I made supplication (specific request).

96.3: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvelous works and wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
96.5: For all the gods of the peoples are [worthless, lifeless] idols, But the LORD made the heavens.
96.12: Let the field be exultant, and all that is in it. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
96.10: Say among the nations, "The LORD reigns; Indeed, the world is firmly and securely established, it shall not be moved; He will judge and rule the people with fairness."
96.2: Sing to the LORD, bless His name; Proclaim good news of His salvation from day to day.
96.8: Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name; Bring an offering and come into His courts.
96.11: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; Let the sea roar, and all the things it contains;
96.1: O sing to the LORD a new song; Sing to the LORD, all the earth!
96.9: Worship the LORD in the splendor of holiness; Tremble [in submissive wonder] before Him, all the earth.
96.7: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, Ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
96.6: Splendor and majesty are before Him; Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
96.4: For great is the LORD and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
96.13: Before the LORD, for He is coming, For He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness And the peoples in His faithfulness.

128.3: Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine Within the innermost part of your house; Your children will be like olive plants Around your table.
128.2: For you shall eat the fruit of [the labor of] your hands, You will be happy and blessed and it will be well with you.
128.1: A Song of Ascents. Blessed [happy and sheltered by God's favor] is everyone who fears the LORD [and worships Him with obedience], Who walks in His ways and lives according to His commandments.
128.4: Behold, for so shall the man be blessed and divinely favored Who fears the LORD [and worships Him with obedience].
128.6: Indeed, may you see your [family perpetuated in your] children's children. Peace be upon Israel!
128.5: May the LORD bless you from Zion [His holy mountain], And may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life;

97.7: Let all those be [deeply] ashamed who serve carved images, Who boast in idols. Worship Him, all you gods!
97.9: For You are the LORD Most High over all the earth; You are exalted far above all gods.
97.10: You who love the LORD, hate evil; He protects the souls of His godly ones (believers), He rescues them from the hand of the wicked.
97.3: Fire goes before Him And burns up His adversaries on all sides.
97.11: Light is sown [like seed] for the righteous and illuminates their path, And [irrepressible] joy [is spread] for the upright in heart [who delight in His favor and protection].
97.2: Clouds and thick darkness surround Him [as at Sinai]; Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
97.1: The LORD reigns, let the earth rejoice; Let the many islands and coastlands be glad.
97.12: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous ones [those whose moral and spiritual integrity places them in right standing with God], And praise and give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
97.4: His lightnings have illuminated the world; The earth has seen and trembled.
97.6: The heavens declare His righteousness, And all the peoples see His glory and brilliance.
97.5: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97.8: Zion heard this and was glad, And the daughters (cities) of Judah rejoiced [in relief] Because of Your judgments, O LORD.

4.7: You have put joy in my heart, More than [others know] when their wheat and new wine have yielded abundantly.
4.3: But know that the LORD has set apart for Himself [and dealt wonderfully with] the godly man [the one of honorable character and moral courage—the one who does right]. The LORD hears and responds when I call to Him.
4.2: O sons of men, how long will my honor and glory be [turned into] shame? How long will you [my enemies] love worthless (vain, futile) things and seek deception and lies? Selah.
4.1: To the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David. Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You have freed me when I was hemmed in and relieved me when I was in distress; Be gracious to me and hear [and respond to] my prayer.
4.4: Tremble [with anger or fear], and do not sin; Meditate in your heart upon your bed and be still [reflect on your sin and repent of your rebellion]. Selah.
4.6: Many are saying, "Oh, that we might see some good!" Lift up the light of Your face upon us, O LORD.
4.5: Offer righteous sacrifices; Trust [confidently] in the LORD.
4.8: In peace [and with a tranquil heart] I will both lie down and sleep, For You alone, O LORD, make me dwell in safety and confident trust.

46.7: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our stronghold [our refuge, our high tower]. Selah.
46.9: He makes wars to cease to the end of the earth; He breaks the bow into pieces and snaps the spear in two; He burns the chariots with fire.
46.10: "Be still and know (recognize, understand) that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations! I will be exalted in the earth."
46.3: Though its waters roar and foam, Though the mountains tremble at its roaring. Selah.
46.11: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our stronghold [our refuge, our high tower]. Selah.
46.2: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change And though the mountains be shaken and slip into the heart of the seas,
46.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah, set to soprano voices. A Song. God is our refuge and strength [mighty and impenetrable], A very present and well-proved help in trouble.
46.4: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, The holy dwelling places of the Most High.
46.6: The nations made an uproar, the kingdoms tottered and were moved; He raised His voice, the earth melted.
46.5: God is in the midst of her [His city], she will not be moved; God will help her when the morning dawns.
46.8: Come, behold the works of the LORD, Who has wrought desolations and wonders in the earth.

120.7: I am for peace, but when I speak, They are for war.
120.3: What shall be given to you, and what more shall be done to you, You deceitful tongue?—
120.2: Rescue my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, And from a deceitful tongue.
120.1: A Song of Ascents. In my trouble I cried to the LORD, And He answered me.
120.4: Sharp arrows of the warrior, With the burning coals of the broom tree.
120.6: Too long my soul has had its dwelling With those who hate peace.
120.5: Woe to me, for I sojourn in Meshech, and I live among the tents of Kedar [among hostile people]!

74.16: The day is Yours, the night also is Yours; You have established and prepared the [heavenly] light and the sun.
74.3: Turn your footsteps [quickly] toward the perpetual ruins; The enemy has damaged everything within the sanctuary.
74.5: It seems as if one had lifted up An axe in a forest of trees [to set a record of destruction].
74.21: Let not the oppressed return dishonored; Let the afflicted and needy praise Your name.
74.18: Remember this, O LORD, the enemy has scoffed, And a foolish and impious people has spurned Your name.
74.12: Yet God is my King of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.10: O God, how long will the adversary scoff? Is the enemy to revile Your name forever?
74.2: Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old, Which You have redeemed to be the tribe of Your inheritance; Remember Mount Zion, where You have dwelt.
74.22: Arise, O God, plead Your own cause; Remember how the foolish man scoffs at You all day long.
74.8: They said in their heart, "Let us completely subdue them." They have burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.17: You have defined and established all the borders of the earth [the divisions of land and sea and of the nations]; You have made summer and winter.
74.11: Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand [from judging the enemy]? Remove Your hand from Your chest, destroy them!
74.1: A skillful song, or a didactic or reflective poem, of Asaph. O God, why have You rejected us forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
74.9: We do not see our symbols; There is no longer any prophet [to guide us], Nor does any among us know for how long.
74.14: You crushed the heads of Leviathan (Egypt); You gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
74.7: They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground; They have profaned the dwelling place of Your name.
74.15: You broke open fountains and streams; You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
74.20: Consider the covenant [You made with Abraham], For the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.
74.23: Do not forget the [clamoring] voices of Your adversaries, The uproar of those who rise against You, which ascends continually [to Your ears].
74.6: And now all the carved work [of the meeting place] They smash with hatchets and hammers.
74.4: In the midst of Your meeting place Your enemies have roared [with their battle cry]; They have set up their own emblems for signs [of victory].
74.19: Oh, do not hand over the soul of your turtledove to the wild beast; Do not forget the life of Your afflicted forever.
74.13: You divided the [Red] Sea by Your strength; You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.

147.16: He gives [to the earth] snow like [a blanket of] wool; He scatters the frost like ashes.

17.3: You have tried my heart; You have visited me in the night; You have tested me and You find nothing [evil in me]; I intend that my mouth will not transgress.

69.11: When I made sackcloth my clothing [as one in mourning], I became a byword [a mere object of scorn] to them.

69.5: O God, You know my folly; My wrongs are not hidden from You.

69.33: For the LORD hears the needy And does not despise His who are prisoners.

88.16: Your fierce wrath has swept over me; Your terrors have destroyed me.

88.1: A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. To the Chief Musician; set to chant mournfully. A didactic or reflective poem of Heman the Ezrahite. O LORD, the God of my salvation, I have cried out [for help] by day and in the night before You.

88.15: I was afflicted and close to death from my youth on; I suffer Your terrors; I am overcome.

88.13: But I have cried out to You, O LORD, for help; And in the morning my prayer will come to You.

102.11: My days are like an evening shadow that lengthens and vanishes [with the sun]; And as for me, I wither away like grass.

136.16: To Him who led His people through the wilderness, For His lovingkindness endures forever;

55.16: As for me, I shall call upon God, And the LORD will save me.

131.2: Surely I have calmed and quieted my soul; Like a weaned child [resting] with his mother, My soul is like a weaned child within me [composed and freed from discontent].
131.1: A Song of Ascents. Of David. LORD, my heart is not proud, nor my eyes haughty; Nor do I involve myself in great matters, Or in things too difficult for me.

22.11: Do not be far from me, for trouble is near; And there is no one to help.
22.3: But You are holy, O You who are enthroned in [the holy place where] the praises of Israel [are offered].
22.20: Rescue my life from the sword, My only life from the paw of the dog (the executioner).
22.12: Many [enemies like] bulls have surrounded me; Strong bulls of Bashan have encircled me.
22.10: I was cast upon You from birth; From my mother's womb You have been my God.
22.17: I can count all my bones; They look, they stare at me.
22.13: They open wide their mouths against me, Like a ravening and a roaring lion.
22.27: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD, And all the families of the nations will bow down and worship before You,
22.30: Posterity will serve Him; They will tell of the Lord to the next generation.

22.1: To the Chief Musician; set to [the tune of] Aijeleth Hashshahar (The Doe of the Dawn). A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Why are You so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning?
22.5: They cried out to You and were delivered; They trusted in You and were not disappointed or ashamed.
22.4: In You our fathers trusted [leaned on, relied on, and were confident]; They trusted and You rescued them.
22.8: "He trusted and committed himself to the LORD, let Him save him. Let Him rescue him, because He delights in him."
22.26: The afflicted will eat and be satisfied; Those who [diligently] seek Him and require Him [as their greatest need] will praise the LORD. May your hearts live forever!
22.14: I am poured out like water, And all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; It is melted [by anguish] within me.
22.22: I will tell of Your name to my countrymen; In the midst of the congregation I will praise You.
22.28: For the kingship and the kingdom are the Lord's And He rules over the nations.
22.25: My praise will be of You in the great assembly. I will pay my vows [made in the time of trouble] before those who [reverently] fear Him.

22.21: Save me from the lion's mouth; From the horns of the wild oxen You answer me.
22.24: For He has not despised nor detested the suffering of the afflicted; Nor has He hidden His face from him; But when he cried to Him for help, He listened.
22.16: For [a pack of] dogs have surrounded me; A gang of evildoers has encircled me, They pierced my hands and my feet.
22.7: All who see me laugh at me and mock me; They [insultingly] open their lips, they shake their head, saying,
22.2: O my God, I call out by day, but You do not answer; And by night, but I find no rest nor quiet.
22.6: But I am [treated as] a worm [insignificant and powerless] and not a man; I am the scorn of men and despised by the people.

44.16: Because of the voice of the taunter and reviler, Because of the presence of the enemy and the avenger.

44.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A skillful song, or a didactic or reflective poem. We have heard with our ears, O God, Our fathers have told us The work You did in their days, In the days of old.
44.9: But now You have rejected us and brought us to dishonor, And You do not go out with our armies [to lead us to victory].
44.24: Why do You hide Your face And forget our affliction and our oppression?

44.7: But You have saved us from our enemies, And You have put them to shame and humiliated those who hate us.

44.20: If we had forgotten the name of our God Or stretched out our hands to a strange god,
44.25: For our life has melted away into the dust; Our body clings to the ground.

44.6: For I will not trust in my bow, Nor will my sword save me.

44.26: Rise up! Come be our help, And ransom us for the sake of Your steadfast love.
