109.28: Let them curse, but You bless. When adversaries arise, let them be ashamed, But let Your servant rejoice.
109.25: I also have become a reproach and an object of taunting to others; When they see me, they shake their heads [in derision].
109.9: Let his children be fatherless And his wife a widow.
109.15: Let them be before the LORD continually, That He may cut off their memory from the earth;
109.21: But You, O GOD, the Lord, show kindness to me, for Your name's sake; Because Your lovingkindness (faithfulness, compassion) is good, O rescue me;
109.24: My knees are unsteady from fasting; And my flesh is gaunt and without fatness.
109.16: Because the man did not remember to show kindness, But persecuted the suffering and needy man, And the brokenhearted, to put them to death.
109.7: When he enters into dispute, let wickedness come about. Let his prayer [for help] result [only] in sin.
109.2: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me; They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
109.6: Appoint a wicked man against him, And let an attacker stand at his right hand [to kill him].
109.31: For He will stand at the right hand of the needy, To save him from those who judge his soul.

61.7: He will sit enthroned forever before [the face of] God; Appoint lovingkindness and truth to watch over and preserve him.
61.3: For You have been a shelter and a refuge for me, A strong tower against the enemy.
61.2: From the end of the earth I call to You, when my heart is overwhelmed and weak; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I [a rock that is too high to reach without Your help].
61.1: To the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David. Hear my cry, O God; Listen to my prayer.
61.4: Let me dwell in Your tent forever; Let me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah.
61.6: You will prolong the king's life [adding days upon days]; His years will be like many generations.
61.5: For You have heard my vows, O God; You have given me the inheritance of those who fear Your name [with reverence].
61.8: So I will sing praise to Your name forever, Paying my vows day by day.

15.2: He who walks with integrity and strength of character, and works righteousness, And speaks and holds truth in his heart.
15.4: In his eyes an evil person is despised, But he honors those who fear the LORD [and obediently worship Him with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder]. He keeps his word even to his own disadvantage and does not change it [for his own benefit];
15.5: He does not put out his money at interest [to a fellow Israelite], And does not take a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be shaken.
15.1: A Psalm of David. O LORD, who may lodge [as a guest] in Your tent? Who may dwell [continually] on Your holy hill?
15.3: He does not slander with his tongue, Nor does evil to his neighbor, Nor takes up a reproach against his friend;

140.3: They sharpen their tongues like a serpent's; Poison of a viper is under their lips. Selah.
140.5: The proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords; They have spread a net by the wayside; They have set traps for me. Selah.
140.12: I know [with confidence] that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, And [will secure] justice for the poor.
140.10: "Let burning coals fall upon them; Let them be thrown into the fire, Into deep [water] pits from which they cannot rise.
140.2: They devise evil things in their hearts; They continually [gather together and] stir up wars.
140.8: "Do not grant, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; Do not further their evil device, that they not be exalted. Selah.
140.11: "Do not let a slanderer be established in the earth; Let evil quickly hunt the violent man [to overthrow him and stop his evil acts]."
140.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; Protect me from violent men.
140.9: "Those who surround me raise their heads; May the mischief of their own lips come upon them.
140.7: "O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You have covered my head in the day of battle.
140.6: I said to the LORD, "You are my God; Listen to the voice of my supplications, O LORD.
140.4: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; Protect me from violent men Who intend to trip up my steps.
140.13: Surely the righteous will give thanks to Your name; The upright will dwell in Your presence.

86.16: Turn to me, and be gracious to me; Grant Your strength [Your might and the power to resist temptation] to Your servant, And save the son of Your handmaid.
86.3: Be gracious and merciful to me, O Lord, For to You I cry out all the day long.
86.5: For You, O Lord, are good, and ready to forgive [our sins, sending them away, completely letting them go forever and ever]; And abundant in lovingkindness and overflowing in mercy to all those who call upon You.
86.12: I will give thanks and praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart; And will glorify Your name forevermore.
86.10: For You are great and do wondrous works! You alone are God.
86.2: Protect my life (soul), for I am godly and faithful; O You my God, save Your servant, who trusts in You [believing in You and relying on You, confidently committing everything to You].
86.8: There is no one like You among the gods, O Lord, Nor are there any works [of wonder and majesty] like Yours.
86.17: Show me a sign of [Your] goodwill, That those who hate me may see it and be ashamed, Because You, O LORD, helped and comforted me.
86.11: Teach me Your way, O LORD, I will walk and live in Your truth; Direct my heart to fear Your name [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder].
86.1: A Prayer of David. Incline Your ear, O LORD, and answer me, For I am distressed and needy [I long for Your help].
86.9: All nations whom You have made shall come and kneel down in worship before You, O Lord, And they shall glorify Your name.
86.14: O God, arrogant and insolent men have risen up against me; A band of violent men have sought my life, And they have not set You before them.
86.7: In the day of my trouble I will call upon You, For You will answer me.
86.15: But You, O Lord, are a God [who protects and is] merciful and gracious, Slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness and truth.
86.6: Hear, O LORD, my prayer; And listen attentively to the voice of my supplications (specific requests)!
86.4: Make Your servant rejoice, For to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul [all that I am—in prayer].
86.13: For great is Your lovingkindness and graciousness toward me; And You have rescued my life from the depths of Sheol [from death].

26.7: That I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving And declare all Your wonders.
26.9: Do not sweep my soul away with sinners, Nor [sweep away] my life with men of bloodshed,
26.10: In whose hands is a wicked scheme, And whose right hand is full of bribes.
26.3: For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes, And I have walked [faithfully] in Your truth.
26.11: But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; Redeem me and be merciful and gracious to me.
26.2: Examine me, O LORD, and try me; Test my heart and my mind.
26.1: A Psalm of David. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity; I have [relied on and] trusted [confidently] in the LORD without wavering and I shall not slip.
26.12: My foot stands on a level place; In the congregations I will bless the LORD.
26.4: I do not sit with deceitful or unethical or worthless men, Nor seek companionship with pretenders (self-righteous hypocrites).
26.6: I will wash my hands in innocence, And I will go about Your altar, O LORD,
26.5: I hate the company of evildoers, And will not sit with the wicked.
26.8: O LORD, I love the habitation of Your house And the place where Your glory dwells.

138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch out Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, And Your right hand will save me.
138.3: On the day I called, You answered me; And You made me bold and confident with [renewed] strength in my life.
138.2: I will bow down [in worship] toward Your holy temple And give thanks to Your name for Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have magnified Your word together with Your name.
138.1: A Psalm of David. I will give You thanks with all my heart; I sing praises to You before the [pagan] gods.
138.4: All the kings of the land will give thanks and praise You, O LORD, When they have heard of the promises of Your mouth [which were fulfilled].
138.6: Though the LORD is exalted, He regards the lowly [and invites them into His fellowship]; But the proud and haughty He knows from a distance.
138.5: Yes, they will sing of the ways of the LORD [joyfully celebrating His wonderful acts], For great is the glory and majesty of the LORD.
138.8: The LORD will accomplish that which concerns me; Your [unwavering] lovingkindness, O LORD, endures forever— Do not abandon the works of Your own hands.

36.7: How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! The children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
36.9: For with You is the fountain of life [the fountain of life-giving water]; In Your light we see light.
36.10: O continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And Your righteousness (salvation) to the upright in heart.
36.3: The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
36.11: Do not let the foot of the proud [person] overtake me, And do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
36.2: For he flatters and deceives himself in his own eyes Thinking that his sinfulness will not be discovered and hated [by God].
36.1: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of the LORD. Transgression speaks [like an oracle] to the wicked (godless) [deep] within his heart; There is no fear (dread) of God before his eyes.
36.12: There those who [are perverse and] do evil have fallen; They have been thrust down and cannot rise.
36.4: He plans wrongdoing on his bed; He sets himself on a path that is not good; He does not reject or despise evil.
36.6: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God, Your judgments are like the great deep. O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
36.5: Your lovingkindness and graciousness, O LORD, extend to the skies, Your faithfulness [reaches] to the clouds.
36.8: They drink their fill of the abundance of Your house; And You allow them to drink from the river of Your delights.

38.16: For I pray, "May they not rejoice over me, Who, when my foot slips, would boast against me."
38.3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation; There is no health in my bones because of my sin.
38.5: My wounds are loathsome and foul Because of my foolishness.
38.21: Do not abandon me, O LORD; O my God, do not be far from me.
38.18: For I do confess my guilt and iniquity; I am filled with anxiety because of my sin.
38.12: Those who seek my life lay snares for me, And those who seek to injure me threaten mischievous things and destruction; They devise treachery all the day long.
38.10: My heart throbs violently, my strength fails me; And as for the light of my eyes, even that has also gone from me.
38.2: For Your arrows have sunk into me and penetrate deeply, And Your hand has pressed down on me and greatly disciplined me.
38.22: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my Salvation.
38.8: I am numb and greatly bruised [deadly cold and completely worn out]; I groan because of the disquiet and moaning of my heart.
38.17: For I am ready to fall; My sorrow is continually before me.
38.11: My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague; And my neighbors stand far away.
38.1: A Psalm of David; to bring to remembrance. O LORD, do not rebuke me in Your wrath, Nor discipline me in Your burning anger.
38.9: Lord, all my desire is before You; And my sighing is not hidden from You.
38.14: Yes, I am like a man who does not hear, In whose mouth are no arguments.
38.7: For my sides are filled with burning, And there is no health in my flesh.
38.15: For in You, O LORD, I hope; You will answer, O Lord my God.
38.20: They repay evil for good, they attack and try to kill me, Because I follow what is good.
38.6: I am bent over and greatly bowed down; I go about mourning all day long.
38.4: For my iniquities have gone over my head [like the waves of a flood]; As a heavy burden they weigh too much for me.
38.19: But my [numerous] enemies are vigorous and strong, And those who hate me without cause are many.
38.13: But I, like a deaf man, do not hear; I am like a mute man who does not open his mouth.

7.16: His mischief will return on his own head, And his violence will come down on the top of his head [like loose dirt].
7.3: O LORD my God, if I have done this, If there is injustice in my hands,
7.5: Let the enemy pursue me and overtake me; And let him trample my life to the ground And lay my honor in the dust. Selah.
7.12: If a man does not repent, God will sharpen His sword; He has strung and bent His [mighty] bow and made it ready.
7.10: My shield and my defense depend on God, Who saves the upright in heart.
7.2: So that my enemy will not tear me like a lion, Dragging me away while there is no one to rescue [me].
7.8: The LORD judges the peoples; Judge me, O LORD, and grant me justice according to my righteousness and according to the integrity within me.
7.17: I will give thanks to the LORD according to His righteousness and justice, And I will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.
7.11: God is a righteous judge, And a God who is indignant every day.
7.1: An Ode of David, [perhaps in a wild, irregular, enthusiastic strain,] which he sang to the LORD concerning the words of Cush, a Benjamite. O LORD my God, in You I take refuge; Save me and rescue me from all those who pursue me,
7.9: Oh, let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous [those in right standing with You]; For the righteous God tries the hearts and minds.
7.14: Behold, the [wicked and irreverent] man is pregnant with sin, And he conceives mischief and gives birth to lies.
7.7: Let the assembly of the nations be gathered around You, And return on high over them.
7.15: He has dug a pit and hollowed it out, And has fallen into the [very] pit which he made [as a trap].
7.6: Arise, O LORD, in Your anger; Lift up Yourself against the rage of my enemies; Rise up for me; You have commanded judgment and vindication.
7.4: If I have done evil to him who was at peace with me, Or without cause robbed him who was my enemy,
7.13: He has also prepared [other] deadly weapons for Himself; He makes His arrows fiery shafts [aimed at the unrepentant].

63.7: For You have been my help, And in the shadow of Your wings [where I am always protected] I sing for joy.
63.9: But those who seek my life to destroy it Will [be destroyed and] go into the depths of the earth [into the underworld].
63.10: They will be given over to the power of the sword; They will be a prey for foxes.
63.3: Because Your lovingkindness is better than life, My lips shall praise You.
63.11: But the king will rejoice in God; Everyone who swears by Him [honoring the true God, acknowledging His authority and majesty] will glory, For the mouths of those who speak lies will be stopped.
63.2: So I have gazed upon You in the sanctuary, To see Your power and Your glory.
63.1: A Psalm of David; when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, You are my God; with deepest longing I will seek You; My soul [my life, my very self] thirsts for You, my flesh longs and sighs for You, In a dry and weary land where there is no water.
63.4: So will I bless You as long as I live; I will lift up my hands in Your name.
63.6: When I remember You on my bed, I meditate and thoughtfully focus on You in the night watches,
63.5: My soul [my life, my very self] is satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And my mouth offers praises [to You] with joyful lips.
63.8: My soul [my life, my very self] clings to You; Your right hand upholds me.

124.7: We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowlers; The trap is broken and we have escaped.
124.3: Then they would have [quickly] swallowed us alive, When their wrath was kindled against us;
124.2: "If it had not been the LORD who was on our side When men rose up against us,
124.1: A Song of Ascents. Of David. "If it had not been the LORD who was on our side," Let Israel now say,
124.4: Then the waters would have engulfed us, The torrent would have swept over our soul;
124.6: Blessed be the LORD, Who has not given us as prey to be torn by their teeth.
124.5: Then the raging waters would have swept over our soul."
124.8: Our help is in the name of the LORD, Who made heaven and earth.

148.3: Praise Him, sun and moon: Praise Him, all stars of light!
148.5: Let them praise the name of the LORD, For He commanded and they were created.
148.12: Both young men and virgins; Old men and children.
148.10: Beasts and all cattle; Creeping things and winged birds;
148.2: Praise Him, all His angels; Praise Him, all His hosts (armies)!
148.8: Lightning and hail, snow and fog; Stormy wind, fulfilling His orders;
148.11: Kings of the earth and all people; Princes and all judges of the earth;
148.1: Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the heavens; Praise Him in the heights!
148.9: Mountains and all hills; Fruitful trees and all cedars;
148.14: He has lifted up a horn for His people [giving them strength, prosperity, dignity, and preeminence], Praise for all His godly ones; For the people of Israel, a people near to Him. Praise the LORD! (Hallelujah!)
148.7: Praise the LORD from the earth, Sea monsters and all deeps;
148.6: He has also established them forever and ever; He has made a decree which shall not pass away.
148.4: Praise Him, highest heavens, And the waters above the heavens!
148.13: Let them praise the name of the LORD, For His name alone is exalted and supreme; His glory and majesty are above earth and heaven.

95.7: For He is our God And we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Today, if you will hear His voice,
95.9: "When your fathers tested Me, They tried Me, even though they had seen My work [of miracles].
95.10: "For forty years I was grieved and disgusted with that generation, And I said, 'They are a people who err in their heart, And they do not acknowledge or regard My ways.'
95.3: For the LORD is a great God And a great King above all gods,
95.11: "Therefore I swore [an oath] in My wrath, 'They absolutely shall not enter My rest [the land of promise].'"
95.2: Let us come before His presence with a song of thanksgiving; Let us shout joyfully to Him with songs.
95.1: O come, let us sing joyfully to the LORD; Let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
95.4: In whose hand are the depths of the earth; The peaks of the mountains are His also.
95.6: O come, let us worship and bow down, Let us kneel before the LORD our Maker [in reverent praise and prayer].
95.5: The sea is His, for He made it [by His command]; And His hands formed the dry land.
95.8: Do not harden your hearts and become spiritually dull as at Meribah [the place of strife], And as at Massah [the place of testing] in the wilderness,
